body.body: Homogenize a murine brain in 2 ml LBA lysis buffer
Spin down at 16,000 g, 10 min, 4<sup>o</sup>C
Take supernatans and measure protein concentration.
Incubate 1.5 mg protein with protein-G sepharose beads for 30 min at 4<sup>o</sup>C.
Spin samples down at 6,000 g, 5 min, 4<sup>o</sup>C.
Incubate overnight at 4<sup>o</sup>C these pre-cleared supernatans with protein-G Sepharose beads and 5 μg EphB2-Fc \(precipitate) or Fc \(control for unspecific protein binding).
Spin them down at 6,000 g, 5 min, 4<sup>o</sup>C.
Wash beads three times with HNTG buffer
Add 20 μl Loading buffer
Boil samples for 5 min. Load in a 9% SDS-PAGE gel and develop by Western blot with the desired antibodies.
Cluster EphB2- Fc or Fc one hour prior stimulation at RT: Mix EphB2-Fc/Fc 1 μg/ml + 1/10 anti-hFc \(0.1 μg/ml)
Wash neurons 2 x with HBSS.
Add EphB2-Fc/Fc clusters to pre-warmed NB medium.

Apply to the neurons and incubate at 37<sup>o</sup>C for 1 hr
  


B2. Neuron lysates
Place plates on ice and wash twice with cold PBS.
Lyse cells in PLC buffer; incubate at 4<sup>o</sup>C for 10 min; spin down samples at 16,000 g 10 min 4<sup>o</sup>C.

Take supernatans and measure protein concentration.
  


B3. EphB2-Fc precipitation
Incubate 3 mg total protein from the neuron lysates with protein-G Sepharose beads for 1 hr at 4<sup>o</sup>C.
Add 10 μg of EphB2-Fc or Fc to the appropriate sample
Incubate overnight at 4<sup>o</sup>C.
Spin them down at 6,000 g, 5 min, 4<sup>o</sup>C.
Wash beads three times with HNTG buffer
Add 20 μl Loading buffer
Boil samples for 5 min. Resolve in a 7.5% SDS-PAGE gel and develop by Western blot with the desired antibodies.
